As a Shen main I am also very disappointed at this... 
The big blade is silly and the weird energy blade is just not him. 

All up, as a fan of Riot and League of Ledgends, you have really let me down.

Shen is one of my favourite champions to play because his gameplay is simplistic and the skill in being a good shen player comes from observation and picking the right time to use your abilities. it feels like riot is trying to shut out an entire demographic of players who enjoy champions that are simple to play, easy to learn but hard to master. This spirit dagger spits in the face of his current gameplay, it forces him to play aggressive to get the best effect out of his abilities. removing his Q and Ki strike pretty much makes him an easy target to bully in lane and takes away his ability to farm waves without getting his teeth kicked in by other top laners and damns him to the jungle where he can't really do much aside from afk farm and counter gank as his standard ganks are horrifically telegraphed and predictable or as a support that can't do anything for for his ADC unless the enemy makes a really bad decision and decides to all in your adc for no reason. These changes are poorly thought out and will mean the death of the champion, it feels like your just trying to slap some "cool moves" onto shen just to make him more appealing to people who prefer to play carries with flashy abilities who in my experience suck at playing tanks anyway. you are taking a champion that belongs to one demographic of players and panning him off to another demographic who probably won't even enjoy playing him even after the changes. I actually feel like I deserve my money back for my skin at this point because when I bought the skin it was to show my dedication to the champion and this reworked shen is not the thing I paid for nor is it even remotely close. Taric is up next on the rework list and he is currently my most played champion as he excells in the current meta and has always been one of my favourites, if you murder him like you've done to shen then I'm taking a break from league for a year or two until riot sorts their shit out and stops experimenting like crazy and trying to fix things that aren't broken. I'd be more than happy to see this dagger mechanic in game but not on shen, not in a million years on shen. Riot is going too far to put mechanics where they don't belong, this sort of ability is something that suits a bruiser a lot more than it does a tank.

Just wanna clarify for peeps, his W doesnt require an ally to function, it drops a zone, if an ally is in it, or enters it, it activates immediately, otherwise it waits 2 seconds, then triggers anyway. So you can use it in a solo lane, taunt, drop zone, pull Q through enemy, deal buttloads of damage while youve got a shield and cant be hit by auto's.

His q btw as it stands on the PBE, empowers each of his autos to deal 7.5% of the targets MAX hp on each attack (22.5%) at rank 5, meaning he can lay the hurt on you regardless if you are a tank or squishy, im thinkin liandrys torment might be interesting. Oh it also empowers your autos even if you dont hit an enemy with it (just empowers more and makes you attack 50% faster if you do)

His E (the dash taunt) gains bonus damage scaling off your bonus hp aswell, so it actually hurts now aswell as taunts.

Also his shield on his passive scales off bonus hp aswell!

I like this rework because he's actually tankier and makes for a better tank (has 3 ways to forcibly protect his allies now instead of 2) hes tankier now especially late game as his new passive ties a shield that scales off hp to every single one of his abilities, with enough hp and proper timing, they cant burn through your shield before it refreshes, not only does this mean they need to focus you ( thus taking attention off your allies) to burn through your shield, but you are also mitigating said aggro.

Further more, since he now does max hp scaling damage (scales higher with ap) they cant ignore you either, making you an even more effective tank.

In all honesty, I think Riot should bring out a vote for either keeping old Shen or reworking him. Its obvious that some people are liking the new Shen but also obvious that some people prefer him the old way.
